numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I wonder if the poll is adequately convincing.
2. The poll has about 1000 respondents from each country on average.
3. 1000 respondents represent only a tiny portion of a country's total population.
4. The UK has 67 million people.
5. 1000 people out of 67 million people is 0.0015 percent.
6. This sample cannot precisely show what the people of the UK generally think about the question.
7. The interviews are done through telephone calls.
8. The interviews are not done in person.
9. The interviews are not done through video chats.
10. If an interview is done through a telephone call then a respondent does not have to take the interview seriously.
11. This reduces the credibility of the poll.
12. It is not possible to cover everybody.
13. It is not possible to interview everybody in person.
14. 1000 respondents from every country is still a large sample size.
15. However, we should still have doubts about the credibility of the poll.
16. The poll asks respondents about the entire world.
17. Most people might think only about their own country.
18. Most people care most about their own country.
19. What a person thinks about the person's own country does not necessarily relate to whether the world is getting better.
20. This is a potential loophole.
21. This loophole could reduce the authenticity of the survey results.
22. This loophole could reduce the relevance of the survey results.
23. Despite these issues, the survey is interesting.
24. The survey is worthy of noting.
25. The survey is worthy of further research.
